page.title: 05HOUSING,CATON & BROOKHOUSE
page.content: The majority of houses in Brookhouse are bungalows and dormers.Many of these houses have been built in the last 25 years.There are two houses being built at present,one next to Brookhouse Old Hall and the other on Broadacre.There are two three storey houses named Vale Cottages,which were built in 1865 using stone from the rebuilding of St.Paul's Church,Brookhouse.A feature of the houses are the stone staircases and many of these old houses have wells.In 1885 Albert Greg changed eight small houses into four eyecatching cottages. Albert Greg named them Rock M'Jock to remind him of the sound that the people could hear from their houses when Willow Mill's machinery was in use. The oldest house is Gresgarth Hall,originally built in the 12th Century as a monks' Rest House.Today building is restricted in this area.
